meanings.definition: Excessively bright or flashy in a way that is tasteless or showy.
meanings.sent1: The garish neon sign hurt my eyes.
meanings.sent2: She wore a garish outfit to the party.
meanings.sent3: The garish decorations at the event clashed with the elegant theme.
meanings.sent4: The garish colors of the painting screamed for attention.
meanings.sent5: The garish display of fireworks lit up the night sky in a gaudy manner.

meanings.sent1: The garish lights of the carnival rides filled the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The garish makeup made her stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The garish flowers in the garden seemed to glow in the moonlight.
meanings.sent4: The garish sunset painted the sky in vibrant hues.
meanings.sent5: The garish costume caught everyone's attention at the parade.
